Reviews.Title: “Feels more like a hostel than a hotel”
Reviews.Author: kellykellykelly43
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay in SOHO and chose this reasonably priced hotel based on the address & 4 star Trip Advisor rating. Maybe my expectations were just too high, but I was disappointed. POSITIVES: On-site staff do a good job with what they have. People were friendly at the front desk, helped me with directions; the housekeepers made my room as clean as they could. Location is very central & a short walk to great shops & restaurants. MY GRIPES: 1. My room was "grimy." Stains on the shower curtain, basin, walls in the room need scrubbing, towels have been used so many times they're paper-thin. I wouldn't walk barefoot on the carpet. 2. Security. There was a front desk person present whenever I came & went, but I don't know if they were there all night. There is no elevator key card required to get onto the guest rooms and the hotel is small. I found myself spooked thinking anyone could walk in off the street & potentially be outside my door. 3. Thin walls. I heard my neighbors & forget trying to sleep in. 4. WIFI was spotty / non-functional, and no cable TV. This pissed me off. I had jet lag and was up for most of the night without internet access, trying to watch local stations through the fuzzy off-air antenna. Not cool. Note that the location is SOHO, but it's the part that runs into Chinatown. I feel a bit guilty slamming this place since so many other people found it pleasant, and the staff are really kind - but I would never return. In hindsight I should have checked out after the 1st night.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average service”
Reviews.Author: DWAH
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay in lower Manhattan so this Soho hotel was ideal. Within a few minutes walk of Little Italy, Nolita, and Chinatown, close to the metro, and with diners, grocery stores and lots of shopping close by. The rooms were small but had everything we needed (desk, flat screen TV, wifi, iron/ironing board, hairdryer). They rooms were clean and the showers were good. We found the service inconsistent. Overall the front desk staff were good and helpful but there were a couple of little things that we found annoying. There was supposed to be "complimentary" water left in the room each day but ti seemed to be that you only got it when you left a tip for the housekeeping staff. It was cheaper just to buy it. Where they did let themselves down was after we checked out. We left a couple of small, low value items in the room. We contacted the hotel immediately and it took several days of chasing before they responded - and the response was only to say that they would check to see if they could find them. We haven't heard anything since. It just seemed like "we've got their money, they won't be back, we don't care".

Reviews.Title: “Good location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cricco77 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Solita Soho Hotel is a small Hotel situated in the middle of Soho. The rooms are not very large but confortable. The staff is kind and they can give you some suggestione about where to go near the hotel! You also have Metro station at only 5 minutes on foot. Nearby the hotel there are lots of good bar; bakeries and restaurants where having breakfast or brunch, we reccomend you Once upon a tart, Select bar, Eileen's cheesekake, Brinklees pub (very good american giant burgers). If you want to enjoy shopping, you can reach Spring street or Broaway Av in just 10 minutes. Chinatown is just around the corner!!! Reccomended!!!

Reviews.Title: “I loved it. Excellent Hotel & would certainly stay again!”
Reviews.Author: razorrus
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this Hotel a great deal. Beds were very comfortable. The decor was modern and new. Obviously the hotel is smaller than most non-New York Hotels, but for NY standards its identical. Staff & management were very friendly and accommodating. I extended my stay for 2 days and they honored my discounted rate from choice. Most hotels are not very accommodating when it comes to this but it was nice that they were. Strongly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Small But Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Hayden W
Reviews.Content: Really Comfortable, Welcoming Staff, Conveniently Located To The Landmark Diner Next Door Which Is Amazing And Cheap, The Chinese Shop Just Round The corner is great too.. The Internet worked well and the a bathroom was great ! Its Close TO The Subway. And Near Streets In Which Have A Lot Of Character And Cute We Shops... (China Town Etc) Had An Amazing Time Over All.. Fantastic Place To Stay Highly Recomended !

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: NinaV8
Reviews.Content: Back in March 2011, I used my credit card miles to book a room for one night at the Solito. The hotel has a great location. The staff was friendly. Most important: NO bedbugs. That said, the room I got was kinda down at the heels; water damage to the wallpaper and a TV channel changer held together with tape were two of the things I noted. Also, at that time there was no wifi (I understand this has changed). I asked about switching rooms but was told nothing else was available. I do a lot of hostels overseas and the room was free so for one night it wasn't that big a deal

Reviews.Title: “great hotel -reasonable price too”
Reviews.Author: Don H
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel in Soho. I like going across the street for breakfast at Landmark Diner, next door for a bottle of Chilean wine, and around the corner to a good Thai restaurant. The rooms are clean and comfy, the wireless is free, and the staff is friendly and unpretentious.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location, and Value”
Reviews.Author: BClarkMN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Solito in January 2012. The hotel is a great boutique NYC hotel. The rooms were super clean and average size for NYC. The bathroom is bigger than others we've stayed at in the city and has lots of counter space. The staff at the hotel made our trip even better. We ate at a couple very nice restaurants during our trip but my favorite meal was at the Spring Natural Cafe the staff recommended. They also helped us get to LGA airport during rush hour by providing helpful tips and calling a car service. Make sure you interact with the front desk staff they will make your trip a better experience. We were able to check into our room at noon which was great since we stayed in Midtown the night before. It is always a hassle to come back later to "move in" it is little things like this that can make a hotel stay more enjoyable. The location of the hotel is good. You're a few blocks away from subway stations for many lines so you can get anywhere in Manhattan in about 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Moonsigh
Reviews.Content: The Solita Soho is a great place to stay. The staff is always so helpful and courteous, the location is amazing, and the rooms are clean and comfortable. For my needs there could not be a better place to stay in lower Manhattan. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “What a great time!”
Reviews.Author: OscarTrout
Reviews.Content: Be it your first time, or a regular visitor, the Solita is a wonderful place to stay for location alone. This little boutique is modern, clean, and staffed by some very friendly knowledgeable people genuinely interested in the seeing that you have a great time on your visit. Transportation between the airport and hotel is relatively easy, the check-in and check-out were a breeze, leaving you relaxed and focused on whatever brings you to New York. Located in Lower Manhattan, it sits at an apex of several areas of the city putting the Lower Eastside, Greenwich Village, Meatpacking District, Broadway, Canal Street, Little Italy, East Village, West Village, Chinatown, WTC, Financial District,etc. all within walking distance. Several subway lines make stops at Canal Street and within the general vicinity of the hotel, leaving you with basically the entire city at your disposal in a matter of minutes. Rooms are clean and reasonably priced, cleaning staff unobtrusive but prompt, and again the staff - who were very helpful arranging transportation, providing directions or suggestions for sight seeing, shopping, dining and night life. I definitely have the Solita in mind for my coming return visit to New York.

Reviews.Title: “location and staff”
Reviews.Author: sharon l
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Solita SoHo for the first time. The staff at the front desk was more than helpful with sights to see, subway help for 1st time users and where to eat. The location was incredible ! Loved walking into Little Italy and Chinatown at night after a busy day uptown and getting a Gelato and coffee. The downsides to this hotel we found was the size. For a family of 4, two being teenage girls that love to "pack" a different outfit forevery occasion, there wasn't enough room for our lugguge. We were ontop of each other while in the room getting ready to go out. My husband spent ALOT of time waiting in the lobby or standing in the hallway. We had a room fasing Grand street on the 2nd floor. It was very noisey with traffic, hearing ppl talking outside and you feel the subway running underground.....Alot ! The staff said you can feel the vibration clear to the 11th floor. Now cleanliness, in our case was not good. we arrived to our room with a used plastic cup on the windowsill, girls noticed lipstick "kiss marks" on a wall, doors and light switches were dirty. I just think it really needed a GOOD wash down. We didn't mind it only having one elevator. Since we were just on the 2nd floor we used the stairs. If the staff wouldn't of been so nice I probably wouldn't reccomend this hotel. I would definitely return, if they clean the rooms better and I take just one other person with me.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for SoHo Shopping”
Reviews.Author: StarfishandSeashells
Reviews.Content: Booked through ChoiceHotels.com and prepaid for lowest rate. Located at the edge of SoHo. About a 3 minute walk to subway at Canal Street. We walked to 9-11 Memorial - about 20 minutes down Broadway. Front desk was friendly and easy check in. Hotel is very, very small. Two full beds with down comforter (not the highest quality, but sufficient). Heater worked well. Black and white modern decor. Small flat screen TV (we've never once used a TV in NYC). Room is quite small, but adequate for sleeping, which is all you should be doing in a NYC hotel. Small desk. No closet, but small wardrobe. Iron & ironing board. Hair dryer. WONDERFUL dual large, adjustable shower heads and curved shower rod. Sink is located in the bathroom. No fan. Spa-type toiletries. VERY HOT water. Coffee maker in room. Elevator. Our room was street view, which we love. Yes it is noisy. The only window coverings are Roman shades, which do not block all light. We were able to check baggage upon check-out. My only concern with the hotel was regarding this. They do not have locked storage. Our bags, including shopping bags were stowed in a back hallway. There is no foot traffic in this area, however, anyone could take them if the one-person front desk staff was distracted. Excellent diner across the street for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Staff!”
Reviews.Author: CObear719
Reviews.Content: What an amazing place. Perfect location! Little Italy, Chinatown, Subway and even Battery Park all within walking distance. Great dining and shopping in SOHO right outside your door. Yes, the rooms are small like most NYC hotels,but I was quite satisfied with the bathroom and counter space. Truly what sets this place apart is the staff. I wish I rememeber all their names, but Jaimie in particular and the young man during the day were exceptional. We had taxis, car service to the aiport, reservations. directions, dining suggestions all handeled by the staff without any bother. They followed up with us several times to ensure our special requests had been met. Thank you Solito Soho for a comfortable, safe and memorable experience. My only negative is that their needs to be some deep cleaning-corners, vents, but otherwise rooms were clean and beds were VERY comfortable. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: VBPal
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Solita for the second time this past weekend. Such a nice little hotel. The beds were very comfortable. The staff were so friendly and helpful and the place was very clean. Great shower and water pressure. The rooms are small like most NYC hotel rooms but they come with a safe and free wii fi. The neighborhood has great restaurants and shopping, Little Italy and Chinatown. There is a wonderful little Chinese bakery about a block away on Centre St. called the Fayda. We had great coffee and pastries there every day for a very small price. There is a nice little French restaurant right next door (Paragot) and a great Thai place (Thai Angel) a block west on Grand St. that serves lunch specials until 6:00 p.m. Subway stations are close and convenient. Compared to other places we were looking at, the price was very good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Reception Staff”
Reviews.Author: Pritesh123
Reviews.Content: The Reception staff-team at this Hotel provided exceptionally good service during my stay in August 2011. They were approachable, polite, professional, very friendly and had good knowledge of New York city and its tourist attractions. They supported and guided my family and I with planning and organising our excursions. They advised us of us of all the local attractions, places to eat etc, which helped us and maximise our short stay in the city. This kind of guidance is very much needed if you are not so familiar with the NYC. Thank you once again for the excellent service!

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: timetraveler89
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Solita Hotel for the four years that my daughter was enrolled at NYU. It is small but cozy, and the staff over the years have always been very pleasant and helpful. It is a great location, right next to some cute restaurants and wonderful shopping. I've stayed at other small hotels in the area, but the Solita is by far the best one for location, cleanliness, price and friendliness.

Reviews.Title: “Great price & location”
Reviews.Author: poty13
Reviews.Content: We were on NY for 3 days. I loved the location (reason for which we chose it) -we had 2 subdway stations from 2 different lines very near. -Close to shopping and restaurants. -You have chinatown & soho Rooms: -Pros: Clean, very comfortable beds, silence -Con: We had a room for 4, the beds were ok but you almost couldnÂ´t walk because it was tiny. We didn't care too much about because the hotel room was just to sleep... but something someone might consider. Better staff than other hotels that I've stayed. Overall: we'll stay again. For the price in NY this was one of the best we could find and didn't disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: mihono
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 7th floor. It was quiet. We didn't hear any street noise. Beds were comfortable. Very clean. and staff were awesome. Great location. 2 blocks to main SOHO area.

Reviews.Title: “Really Great!”
Reviews.Author: hihi_11
Reviews.Content: This is a clean hotel with NO bed bugs! I know a lot of people said it was small, but I thought it was a very nice size especially for NYC. Brand new mattresses that were heavenly, double shower heads were really nice. A very friendly staff, and a great location. I would stay here again. My family and friends used this hotel for my wedding and everyone loved it.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it, but...”
Reviews.Author: tobrien8
Reviews.Content: Location was great and staff was great until we returned home and I discovered a $437.00 on my charge card. I had paid in advance as part of a package with air, but then was charged again upon checkout. I tried to contact hotel directly and was not treated very well - they told me I checked late, which was untrue, so I emailed management and received no response. I had to put a "stop" on the charge with my credit card company and when they investigated, the hotel staff never responded to them...Just disappointing

Reviews.Title: “Defintely a great choice for an NYC trip, will go back for sure.”
Reviews.Author: SarahH818
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews for anything really, but I wanted to give this hotel the recommendation it deserves. It's in a fantastic location as many people have said- perfect access to Chinatown, Little Italy, and Soho. Their beds are amazingly comfortable, I had the best/deepest sleep I've had in years. They were so comfortable that I asked the staff about them when I checked out, and they said they had just gotten all new mattress at the beginning of the summer. And while yes the rooms are small, they are very clean and have everything you could need/want. We were on the top floor and had an incredible view of the Empire State Building and most of uptown. I was there for a girls weekend with my three best friends, we fit just fine on the two double beds and didn't have a problem with the small room because we were mostly just there to sleep at the end of the day. Lastly, the staff are very friendly and helpful. And while the hotel doesn't have a complimentary breakfast, there's a diner across the street where you can get a huge breakfast for $6.

Reviews.Title: “was good for the price”
Reviews.Author: someone1283
Reviews.Content: I paid ~215 for a 2 bed room, which seemed like a great price for the SOHO area. The negatives were street and subway (apparently a subway line runs beneath the building) noise that are loud enough to keep some people from sleeping and there was no wireless internet in my room even though I requested it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice little hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: TitaMerello
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in Soho [formally, the hotel is located in Chinatown/Little Italy]. Subway stations are close by and although hotel is in the middle of it all, it is quite in comparison to hotels on busier streets [think Canal or Houston] and for NYC standards. We asked for a room in the back [king bed rather than double beds] so it was better in terms of noises. Hotel is basic but clean and well-appointed. Having lived in NYC and traveled yearly in the last decade since I moved out, room size is not bad especially if you don't have much luggage. Staff was friendly. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Internet is a joke, walls are like paper”
Reviews.Author: ellagmr
Reviews.Content: Switched rooms to get "closer" to the wireless, just to not have it work...nor did the ethernet in either room. Water running through pipes in the walls woke me up....2x.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location for shopping & dining”
Reviews.Author: suniexoxo
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and our daughters just came back from a stay at the Solita Soho and it was a wonderful experience.You cant beat the location....just steps from little Italy & China town.The rooms are very small the four of us squeezed into one room with two double beds but we were only there to sleep and the beds were super comfortable and the the rooms were clean! They put us originally on the 5th floor and we asked to be moved because thats the only floor that didnt get WIfi and with two teenagers we needed that .They moved us immediatley to the 4th floor.The staff also made the whole experience memorable! They were so helpful and couldnt be nicer! Peter who works there during the day and night at the front desk was extremely helpful and so nice he would give you tips on where to eat and provide transportation and any information you wanted. We are so looking forward to our next visit to the Solita and wouldnt stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel if you can get a good price”
Reviews.Author: thebestlisa
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Solita and loved the location. The rooms are typical new york size, small and cramped with little space for luggage, but the rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable. The ipod dock didn't work in our room, but otherwise everything was fine. We got a sale rate of $150 a night and I was very pleased with the location for the price. You can get great knishes right next door, and are in walking distance of many great bars, restaurants, shopping. There's also a subway a block away and a Whole Foods. As others mentioned, the staff are really personable and offer great recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in SOHO”
Reviews.Author: cghelani
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the solita and thought it was a fantastic little hotel in SOHO. The rooms are small but hey its New York City. The furnishings were modern and the staff was absolutely fantastic. The girl at the front desk gave us great advice on local places to eat. I will definately plan on staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Gemm_MV
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Solita for 10 nights in January 2011. We chose this hotel in Soho because our daughter is living two blocks away and we wanted to be close to her. We also chose it as it was such good price when compared to others in Soho. Orginally we were given a corner room on the 9th floor which had a view of the buildings across the road. However on finding free wifi was available on 3rd floor we moved rooms immediately. While this room didn't have much of a view we really needed the wifi for our iPad and iphones so we were very happy. The room is not large but certainly larger than hotels in Europe we have stayed in. However we fitted in fine for the 10 days. The bed was better (firmer) in the 3rd floor room & comfortable. The bathroom has a bath which I considered a bonus given that in Europe this is not something you get for this price. It was 3 blocks to Spring street subway or Canal street subway and so close to all the great eateries, Galleries and shops in Soho. It was easy to get up town or to the financial district. The hotel is right over the subway lines so on the 3rd floor you heard and felt the rumble of the subway, however it wasn't a show stopper for us. The aircon cut in and out regularly and as the room cooled and then reheated. It was a little noisy but didn't stop us from getting sleep. THe staff were helpful and friendly and I would stay there again as Soho is a great location if you want to be on Manhatten Island.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ennekube
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights. A colleague and I selected this hotel because it was the most reasonably priced option (by New York standards only) that was within walking distance of where we needed to go. The hotel is within a very short walk of Soho and Chinatown - I was thrilled with the location. The rooms are extremely small (the bed takes up the majority of the space, and the corner of the door grazed the side of the bed when we tried to open it fully). I really liked the shampoo and conditioner (they come in these very cool screw-top lids) and there was free wi-fi (though it was down one of the days we were there, the hotel staff fixed it as soon as they could and were very courteous about it, so that was fine). No extra "perks" for guests to speak of (except the obligatory TV) but noise and bedbugs were not an issue, so I was happy. I spent my evenings post-work walking around shopping and eating my way through as much of NYC as I could :) Would recommend for those looking for a comfortable boutique option in this part of NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, friendly staff and lovely location.”
Reviews.Author: KB1983
Reviews.Content: I arrived here after having spent a night at an awful hotel nearby. The staff were friendly and extremely helpful. The room was small but neat and everything was clean. I had a wonderful sleep in a super comfy bed. I highly recommend this for the budget-conscious traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, friendly and ideally situated”
Reviews.Author: wenabean
Reviews.Content: The staff on reception were always friendly and helpful. The modern room looked out onto the street which (because we like open windows and fresh air, rather than AC) was rather noisy - especially due to nearby fire station. Although compact, the room was clean and comfortable (with en suite & a great shower). The Solita is ideally placed - being a couple of blocks from Little Italy & Chinatown, and a short walk from subway lines. There are plenty of restaurants, bars and stores nearby. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Option In Soho”
Reviews.Author: podettski
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights. The rooms were clean and well equiped (iron, phone, tv, hairdryer, safe). The location is really great, good subway options and shopping nearby. The doubles are small, so 3 in a room is too tight. For the price its a good option, to stay in such a great location, as space in NY is always at a premium. Staff couldn't be more helpful and the rooms were serviced daily. Aircon was cold but hard to regulate. Wi-fi just introduced.

Reviews.Title: “Shower was great, the rest is just 'not bad'”
Reviews.Author: Bunnydots
Reviews.Content: I stayed here rather than a midtown hotel because a friend was having a special event just a couple of subway stops away. On the plus side, this hotel is on the less expensive side for NYC, has large new bathrooms and awesome showers, nice bath toiletries, ample nice towels, and everything was very clean. The desk staff also were friendly and smiling. Location is fairly decent, as it's close to little shops and restaurants and a subway is 2 blocks away, although I would prefer to stay closer to the subway since 2 fairly unpopulated blocks are pretty long and dark at night. On the minus side, the room and its furnishings were kind of old and dingy. I didn't mind the room being small - I don't need a lot of space to shower and relax in my comfy bed for a couple of nights when I spend my days elsewhere. But the walls were a slightly grimy-looking beige, the door was institutional gray, the desk and wardrobe looked about 25 years old and the air conditioning unit even older than that. I wished the room looked a little more spruce since the old rooms didn't seem to fit very well with the shiny modern lobby. The AC did work as far as cooling the room and I guess I should be grateful for that, but the control for the AC was slightly wonky and I could not get the fan to reliably turn off resulting in the room getting very freezing during the night (and no extra blanket in the room). Also slightly wonky were the in-room safe, which worked but you sometimes had to enter the code 4-5 times to get it to lock, and the flush mechanism on the toilet, which had to be held down to flush and which occasionally made a very loud dying cow noise. I was glad I was traveling alone because the noise would have woken up anyone trying to sleep in the next room had I flushed in the night. My room had a window...that looked out on a ginormous piece of building equipment, so no points for a view. They did provide a bathrobe to use in the room but its belt was missing, so it was a bit hard to use it. Finally, I have to echo the person who said the staff didn't really check to see if the people coming in and out had a key. The outside door is not locked, there is no doorman and the staff including the night staff seem pretty young and not like they could stop anyone from going upstairs anyway. You are also not required to use a key to make the elevator stop at your floor, meaning that anybody can pretty much come in and wander around, which given that it's NYC makes me a little nervous. For the price it wasn't a bad deal considering I spent most of my time out of the room, but I'd probably scout around for more options next time, unless the rooms are overhauled and modernized.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Price, Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: cristynes2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Solita Soho in a Double room with a friend. It was small, but clean comfortable and modern. Really great location in between Little Italy and Soho and near China Town, Canal Street and the Subway. The staff is very nice and the French Cafe Parigot next store is lovely. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price.”
Reviews.Author: dianerad
Reviews.Content: The Solita, like most boutique hotels, is a renovated hotel with very small rooms. The room was clean, and modern with a comfortable bed an soft linens. The bathroom was a little more spacious. The problems - the air conditioning unit was so close to the bed with no way of adjusting the vents, so we had to cover part of it with a towel to be comfortable. The bathroom door was a squeaky pocket door that was not convenient, and the sink for some strange reason was really high. The location right by Little Italy, Soho, Chinatown and the metro is the best thing going for this place

Reviews.Title: “Solita Soho a perfect solution for a NYC visit”
Reviews.Author: kweilbacher2010
Reviews.Content: Yes, it reached 100 degrees during our 5 day stay in NYC. The Solita Soho Hotel was a perfect answer to a faughter/daughter trip to NYC. Peter and Dana and the rest of the staff were delightful and informative. Our room on the 12th floor was very clean, and the beds and pillows were wonderful. The location of the hotel was a deciding factor for us. Near Little Italy and Chinatown, near several subways stops, and even walking distance to the Brooklyn Bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: PG211975
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and I chose the hotel due to its proximity to our conference and were blown away by the service. The front desk manager Stephanie went out of her way to welcome us and make our stay truly enjoyable and memorable. I only wish I could stay at more hotels that had such high levels of service and hotel personnel. The rooms were very cute and comfortable! I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel, relatively cheap”
Reviews.Author: smab08
Reviews.Content: Small hotel, acceptable (nearly low) pricing. Located in SoHo between Chinatown and little Italy. Excellent location to start shopping in SoHo but also in walking distance to Lower Eastside and Financial District. Rooms are very small (welcome to NYC, there is nothing better in that price range), but clean. Hieating & ventilation very lood and either too hot or too cold. Accordingly I would not recommend to stay in winter as we did. Also rooms are too small to reasonably place a baby bed. So families stay away with your little ones!

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT EVER stay here. You will pay for it.”
Reviews.Author: RMA71
Reviews.Content: I went in not expecting much and found much worse. Check-in took forever, they had to go check to room to see if it was "clean." A man somehow opened my door in the middle of the night (luckily, I had the latch closed) and then I discovered BED BUGS. Bites show up about a week later and they are all over my arms and face. I checked out as early as I could and will NEVER go back. After all that, they put a $1500 hold on my credit card. I had to have multiple conversations with the manager to get this cleared up. WORST HOTEL EXPERIENCE EVER.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Biobrat
Reviews.Content: We are Long Islanders and often spend the night in a hotel in the city. We picked this hotel based on the neighborhood and on Tripadvisor reviews. ~Area is very interesting. You could walk in any direction and see wonderful New York neighborhoods. ~Hotel is small and "boutique-y" ~Requested a room on a high floor. Had a lovely partial view of City Hall and Park Row. ~Room was spotless and small ~Bed, particlularly pillows, are comfy ~Bathroom had everything you needed ~Could use better security. Walked right past desk several times, right to the elevator, and nobody checked to see if we were guests. ~Good value for the accomodations and neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: washiwoman
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night at the Solita, and unfortunately, it was very disappointing. Our room had a foul odor, and the front desk was slow in responding to our requests for air freshener. In fact, our other requests pretty much were neglected, and we had to repeatedly call the front desk for a confirmation of our request for a car service for early the next morning. When contacting the hotel about these complaints, we were met with denial of said complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: mollymalones
Reviews.Content: We (3 Irish friends) travelled to NYC end April/early May and stayed at the Solita Soho for 6 nights. Excellent location for trips uptown/downtown with Little Italy 'around the corner' and Spring Street couple of minutes walk. Canal St subway close by as well. Very safe area and we found a nice 'local' 'O Neals' on the next block for that hour between arriving back from trips and heading out again for dinner. The hotel is small and friendly, with clean and comfortable rooms. The real gem in the hotel is Peter on reception - so helpful - moved us up to a higher level floor (less noisy), gave us information on locations, taxi's etc. Our return flight was doubtful because of the volcanic ash and Peter did his best with updates from Aer Lingus reassuring us that our flight would take off - which it did - we would highly recommend this hotel for friendliness/location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fonf64
Reviews.Content: Stayed there twice, once with young child, other with friends. super friendly staff, great location, brand new hotel hence extra clean and design, and price more than reasonable. A real gem. Cheap parking nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: griz2
Reviews.Content: Great small hotel, good location and reasonable price, would definately use it again, just stayed the one night as we were visiting New York for some Christmas shopping, situated just off the Italian quater, so there were some good local restaurants, within walking distance, it was very clean, rooms more than adequete, quiet with all facilities. No restaurant but great diner opposite, with good breakfasts. Rooms were modern and boutique style, all you need for a short stopover.

Reviews.Title: “We will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Frilo68
Reviews.Content: We spent a few days at the Solita, and we were happy with our hotel selection. We had two rooms, both with queen size beds, on one of the higher levels. One room was tiny, but the other was not. It was small, but not any smaller than other hotels with higher prices. Our rate was about $200/night with a AAA discount. The bedrooms were clean and nicely appointed. The bed linens were of good quality, the pillows were feather and down, and the bed was very comfortable. The room had all the necessary items, TV, coffee maker, iron with ironing board, and a small closet with two drawers, and then some, we had free internet connection in the room (we did not have that at a more expensive, higher star level on a prior trip in May). The bathrooms were clean and well appointed as well. The light above the mirror was very good, the towels were large and thick and the shower water pressure was excellent. The elevator was fast and worked properly. The front desk staff as well as the cleaning and service personnel were friendly, efficient and all had a positive attitude. This little hotel is beautifully located within a short walk to SoHo and a few steps from Little Italy and China Town.

Reviews.Title: “A great simple place”
Reviews.Author: jrchicago11
Reviews.Content: We spent a few days at the Solita. The folks at the front desk were all very nice and the rooms were very clean and modern. The rooms were teeny, so if you are looking for closets or space, this is not the right place. It is great to be at the edge of soho and little italy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pretty room, no wireless.”
Reviews.Author: ProfSpice
Reviews.Content: I had to spend a weekend in New York inbetween meetings. I wanted to stay at the Solita because of all the nearby dining, shopping and entertainment possibilities, and it did not disappoint. The rooms are small but nicely decorated, and on the 8th floor, anyway, very quiet. The hipsters at the desk were very friendly. The only disappointment was that there was no wireless in the rooms (I had not cable with me), but I was happy to discover that the cute little New York Public Library branch at Mulberry and Jersey does have free wireless!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: mad4vacation
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, staff were friendly and courteous. It was very clean and nicely outfitted although a small space. We had two double beds, which were very comfortable, great pillows! Outstanding location for Chinatown shopping and near the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on good location”
Reviews.Author: fallen99angel
Reviews.Content: I travel to New York alot and have stayed at various hotels, I usually stay in L.E.S. mainly at the sohotel. Anyway I wanted to try something new and searching around, I found the Solita hotel and booked it for this time. Knowing rooms are tiny and showers usually pretty crappy in NYC, I really really liked this hotel, room ofcourse small, but nice and clean, the shower is actually the best I ever had i NYC. Staff very nice and helpfull. In general Ill say I will definetely be comming back to the hotel next time I hit NYC

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but do not book queen rooms”
Reviews.Author: Love4travels
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean, modern, but queen rooms are too small and hot! You cannot leave the air conditioning on because it is too close to the bed! Book king or double rooms....I saw them while cleaning staff was inside ;-) There is a work in progress area close to one side of the hotel, so if your room is on that side you can hear a little noise when they start working early morning.. Btw his location is fantastic: Soho is a very nice area, 2 blocks from Little Italy, and a walk from South Manhattan or uptown ..subway is close too..

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Lumpy_NewBerlin
Reviews.Content: stayed here 2 nights with my wife and daughter on their first trip to NYC. Great location for walking to stores that were appealing AND affordable for a 16 year old girl. Also walked to some great Chinese and Italian restaurants - all recommendations from the staff. Rooms are really small, but it's New York - what did you expect? The biggest drawback was that the double beds are really only doubles - it's been a long time since my wife & I slept in a double. I forgot how many elbows she had. We stayed on the 4th floor, and didn't notice a lot of street noise. There's no business center and I needed an e-mail printed out. Andrew at the front desk just had me forward the e-mail to him, and he printed it out for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms but nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: 0_oParis_France
Reviews.Content: Great location in NYC, next to Soho, Little Italy, Chinatown and by walking distance of the East Village or Greenwhich Vilage. Loved it, all Manhattan and Brooklyn were easy to access.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, comfortable bed, excellent service...”
Reviews.Author: Bootsie64
Reviews.Content: Okay, so the rooms are small but it is NYC so that's to be expected. I've stayed in larger rooms in the city for around the same price but one was filthy and one we shared with a family of mice. Cleanliness is such much more important to me than size and I was very happy with the cleanliness of our room. The hotel staff was excellent. They were friendly and courteous and quick to respond to our needs. We had the misfortune of being on the second floor, right above the disco, but that didn't really bother us any as we never made it back before 3am. The bed was very comfortable and I don't usually sleep well in hotels but slept great. The location was perfect. Took a walk through little Italy and the St. Anthony's was going on which was a nice surprise. There were a lot of great places to shop within walking distance. I was walked to Katz Deli, a place I visit on every trip to NYC. The subway was right around the corner. We were fortunate to be in town when the John Lennon exhibit was going on at they NYC Rock-n-Roll Hall of Fame annex and that too was within walking distance. I was disappointed with the size of the TV. There is definitely space on that wall for a much larger TV. The hair dryer left a lot to be desired. It would overheat constantly. Overall we were very pleased with our stay and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in lower Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Abby110
Reviews.Content: The Solita is a small hotel in Soho. My husband and I stayed there twice on an extended trip going to and from NY. The price is very reasonable. The rooms are small (as is everything in Manhattan) but very clean and very nicely designed. If you get a room on the higher floors noise is not a problem. The biggest plus of this hotel is the wonderful staff. All of them were genuinely friendly and helpful. The second night of our stay we had problems with some partying college students that woke us up and the person at the desk gave us a price break for the next time we stayed. This is the hotel we will stay in every time we go to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, AAA member discount!”
Reviews.Author: MOrario
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Since this is NYC, don't expect a huge space. However, if you are a very long legged person or someone who requires 'ample' space to walk around the room, this might not be a suitable hotel for you. The room we stayed in was on the 8th floor, so we didn't hear the disco downstairs. When you book, make sure you book at the higher floors ( I recommend 5th floor or higher ). The room was beautiful, the bathroom was decent. It's safe to flush if you're husband's taking a hot shower. Since they give you a few towels, set one on the floor to avoid slipping accidents when you step out of the tub/shower. As far as floor space to set your luggages in, there's enough room for 1 small trolley luggage and a backpack on the floor. If you have anything bigger, you'll have to close you luggage and set it upright, otherwise, you'll be hopping over them to get to the bathroom. There's a safe in the closet ( it can fit a small 13"macbook ), free internet access and a flat screen tv with some decent channels. You get a copy of NYTimes in the AM. Also I highly recommend a cool little bar around the corner ( Baby Grand ): you'll meet the friendliest New Yorkers here. I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Location + Great Hotl= Great time in NYC”
Reviews.Author: dancingbears89
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Solita Soho and loved it. The location could not have been better for us right in Little Italy and walking distance to China town, Greenwich Village. The only complaint that I would have is that the rooms were small like other reviews said, it was tight for all four of us to fit but it worked just fine. Are room was on the 11th floor and we could not hear the nightclub that is right next door(which I was worried we would hear). Other then that the place was awesome definitely worth checking out next time your in NYC, and if you do stay here check out Petit Abeille for breakfast on 134 west broadway only a 14 minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “These reviews are great”
Reviews.Author: mvaldivia32
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews but feel compelled because I read the reviews on this site and they were so helpful. I had a great experience. My room was one of the more noisier ones, I was told, but I slept fine without a problem. The room was clean and bed was better than most hotel beds (soft pillows), bathroom immaculate, and location....awesome, 2 blocks from Ferraro's - yummy. Rooms a bit small but big enough for me, View not so good but so what. Hope this helps you decide, I totally thought it was worth it. Location: East village on the right, Soho all around, what more can you want.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! :o)”
Reviews.Author: oriole2
Reviews.Content: We were taking our daughter to NY for her 16th birthday and wanted to get a feel of living in a big city. Solita Soho was a perfect choice! Short walk (2 blocks) to #6 train taking you straight to Grand Central Station, walking distance to Little Italy(but don't eat there...better Italian food anywhere else!) and Chinatown. After reading some of the negative reviews, I must admit, I was skeptical. Once we arrived I was thrilled! We were on the 10th floor with a great view. We could actually see the tip of the Empire State Bldg. The staff was very pleasant and overly helpful. Room was small, but fine, even for four of us! Who wants to be in the room anyway? To all the women who didn't have a vanity, room to hang of lay out there clothes, Get a Life! Needless to say, my daughter's 16th birthday trip was a huge success which she will always remember and cherish!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: JayDee57
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to New York, and this hotel was recommended by friends. From the minute of arrival to departure we felt well looked after, and most welcomed, which was very nice after exhausting sightseeing in the city. Although 3 in a room, the cleanliness and good housekeeping kept our room fresh the whole week. From the 12th floor we also enjoyed a very good view. The location in Soho is perfect for those who like a more lay back style, which is still very central with very good cafes, restaurants and shops minutes away. The staff were very efficient and welcoming. It would be impossible to write this review without a special mention for Stephanie. Her natural charm, humour, and care, mixed with her efficiency and knowledge of places to enjoy New York made our holiday very special.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient -- a great bargain!”
Reviews.Author: OccasionalAdventurer
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after reading other reviews on TripAdvisor and we were not disappointed! We were looking for a basic but decent hotel that was close to the subway. The hotel is small -- only 42 rooms -- and has no business center, restaurant, or workout room, and not even much of a lobby. Having read that rooms on the lower floors should be avoided due to noise from the nightclub next door, we asked for a room on the highest floor possible and were given one on the top [12th] floor. It was very small, but had a nice flat-screen TV and a clean, modern bathroom -- and a view of the Empire State Building! [It had two double beds, which were each a bit small for two people but otherwise OK.] It was very quiet and we didn't hear any noise from downstairs -- surprising, since the music was very audible when we were in the lobby. We had hot water every morning with no problem [and the shower had two separate shower heads, each of which could be aimed separately]. My husband had forgotten a cable for his computer, and the front-desk clerk gave him a "loaner" one to use while we were there. [The free wi-fi worked well too!] Also, they delivered a New York Times to our door each morning. As advertised, the hotel was about two blocks from the subway. Our only two minor annoyances were: 1. The in-room safe didn't work; we asked for someone to fix it and were told the next evening that it was fixed, but it still didn't work. We ended up just doing without it. 2. One morning when we got on the elevator, we pushed the button to go down to the lobby, but nothing happened. We ended up walking down 12 floors. The front-desk clerk said "Hmmm" when we mentioned the problem and said the elevator had to be re-set, but didn't apologize. When we came back in the evening, the elevator was fixed. All was fine with it until the morning we checked out, when it was out for a few minutes for "routine maintenance". Other than those minor issues, the hotel delivered exactly what we had hoped for -- a clean, quiet room that was a good place to crash after a busy day. I would also recommend the Landmark Coffee Shop located directly across the street -- the pancakes and French toast were very good and the service was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Best thing is the location”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter77Uk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for sightseeing in New York. It's well placed in Soho, so makes a change from staying in Manhattan and the usual touristy areas. Good for 'second timers' to New York who fancy something different! We found it was a good price, had nice (small, but it's New York) clean rooms, and a lovely clean bathroom with good toiletries, big towels and a good hairdryer. Our main concern was going to be noise from the nightclub having seen other reviews on here before. To solve this, we emailed the hotel direct and got a written promise we could have a room on the upper floors. We took this with us and presented it on arrival - we were given the 7th floor which was silent! Couldn't hear it at all, so our ear plugs were not needed. The hotel staff are desperate to get the club closed down, but have had no luck so far with the management and some legal reasons apparently. We had no issues with bedbugs. We had no cause to speak to the manager so can't comment on him, but the reception staff were very friendly and helpful to us. There is a good little deli over the road for breakfast, so you don't have far to go if you're starving when you wake up (no breakfast at the hotel). It's located close to Little Italy and Chinatown, and also a subway stop when coming from the airport with all your luggage; you don't have far to walk (something to bear in mind). Taxi was about $40 - $50 I think, but at 2am we didn't mind paying. Reception staff were very helpful (esp Lorelei) in providing maps and info on things to do, and how to get to attractions, calling taxis etc. There is a really good off-licence over the road with some lovely wines in (unusual in America!) but they close at 11pm, and I think 9 on a Sunday, not crucial but bear in mind if you want a drink in your room after a meal out - the next place is a fair walk away and just sells warm beer. Having said that there are plenty of nice bars around SoHo. No complaints about this hotel, and we would definitely go again and recommend to others. In fact I did recommend to a friend, she has just been, stayed on the 9th floor and had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Family of 4 Spring Break Dwntwn Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: joyzeegoyl
Reviews.Content: The Good: Great location, within walking distance of the Lower East side, SoHo, what's remained of Little Italy, and of course Chinatown. If you go further north, the Village and further south the South Street Seaport. There is a decent diner across the street for breakfast, attached to the hotel is a reasonable French resto...we didn't eat here but looked at the menu and sounds OK with manageable prices considering this is NYC...Ate mostly in Chinatown since it's cheapest, Lombardi's, Katz's. We walked everywhere and saw a lot considering we were only there for 2 nights. The staff was very pleasant. Don't be put off by the gritty, old looking neighborhood. We found it safe. Locals were always milling around. It got quieter at bedtime but you probably won't be able to sleep in in the morning if needed. The Bad: the hotel room is SMALL, say 300 sq feet including bathroom area for $276/night reserved months in advance...this would have been very uncomfortable if the kids (ages 12, 7) were teenagers, the beds were up against the walls that I've banged up my elbows a couple of times..i've banged up my knees on the heating/AC unit because it was too close to the bed... you can't use the iron/board, there is no room to open up the ironing board, we had to relocate the coffee maker to the bathroom to be able to use it...and there is hardly any counter space in the bathroom, so the lesson here is don't bring a lot of luggage/toiletries because there is no room to put them (we only had a medium duffle bag and an overnighter, so it's not like we had a lot of luggage).. the hotel also sells itself as a boutique hotel, i don't see the reason, yeah they have ONE bath robe, there were 4 of us...Oh, maybe because their shampoo/conditioner is organic?.... Make sure you know the address, we passed it by because it does not have a marquee on top. I saw another couple looking for it and they would have passed it if they hadn't heard us talking about the hotel. All in all I would stay here again if i can't find anywhere else to stay. I would recommend this hotel to people who've been to NYC and familiar with the prices, interested in staying downtown and know what they're getting into...

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel in Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: kristineLA
Reviews.Content: I stayed a the Solita Soho for four days during the first week of December for business. Honestly, it wasn't our first choice, but hotel rates in NYC that week were insanely expensive and the Solita was reasonably priced. I think we were pleasantly surprised as you could do a lot worse in NYC. The room was your standard boutique hotel room. A little small, but most are in NYC, and I actually had a double. The heat worked well (very important to me), and it had standard beds and pillows. They also provide you with a robe. There is a small wardrobe for you to store your clothes in, but don't plan on putting your luggage in there, as it won't likely fit. I just left my bag on the extra bed. The bathroom is clean, the toiletries are good, and the shower/water pressure is good too. They have a double shower head which was interesing. My room was right next to the elevator and I had no problems with noise. On a side note...one of my colleagues requested a smoking room and ended up with a room right above the adjacent club. He didn't sleep for days. :-P We thought maybe it was to discourage people from the habit. Location is very convenient. You can walk to Little Italy, Chinatown, and Soho. It's easy to catch a cab. You can grab breakfast across the street at the diner. if you are inclined. The staff at reception offered great restaurant recommendations in Little Italy, all within walking distance. Essentially a good hotel if you need a place to sleep, so it's good for business travelers. If you're looking to hang out in your hotel, then this may not be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Painful and Itchy”
Reviews.Author: 4timesbitten
Reviews.Content: A friend and i checked into the Solita Soho on December 30, 2007. We traveled there from California to celebrate the New Year. On the morning of our second day, i noticed what i thought were mosquito bites on my arms and abdomen and i dismissed it as such. Later that evening i mentioned the bites to my companion and she told me she had the same thing. To my knowledge i have never been bitten by a bedbug so the thought of being bitten by one never crossed my mind until she told me about her bites. After my conversation with her i told the desk clerk that i thought our room had bedbugs. He kind of dismissed it saying they would have the room swept the next day (our departure day). Upon checking out, the desk clerk gave me the name and number of the hotel manager (Mr. Hakim) and aked me to call him the following day. After returning home, i called the hotel and asked for Mr. Hakim. I was told he was out of the building and would return soon. I left my name and telephone number with the person answering the phone and asked that he call me when he returned. When i did not hear from him, i telephoned the hotel again. This time i was told Mr. Hakim was ill and did not return to the hotel the previous day. I left a second message asking that he call me. To this day he has not called me back! In the meantime i went to Choice Hotels web site and left an email regarding my experience at the hotel. I wrote that i simply wanted the manager to return my call to listen to my concern. My guess is my email was sent to Mr Hakim because i received an email (not a phone call) from him. The email was an apology and it stated the hotel would refund 30% of my last night's room rate, roughly $30 dollars. I sent an email back to Mr. Hakim asking that he call me and telling him i thought his offer was unacceptable! After returning home i went to a doctor because the bites on my body were extremely uncomfortable and the skin around the bite sites was dying and peeling off. Upon seeing the bites the doctor said he knew they were made by bedbugs. After returning home i mentioned my experience to a co-worker. He provided me with an article written in November 2007 describing the bedbug problem on the east coast as near epidemic. I have never written a review of a hotel or any other business in my life and i probably would have never written this one had i received a call from someone in charge at the hotel willing to listen to my concerns. Instead i was dismissed and ignored! Bedbugs are disgusting littled creatures. I don't know if my reaction to their bites is common. It is now January 14th and i still have evidence of the bites on my skin. The thing that concerns me the most is they could have gotten into my suitcase or other clothing and i could have transported them home. They can live up to a year without feeding. Once you have them in your house they are extremely difficult to get rid of. I wanted soemone at the hotel to be responsive to my concerns, they were not!! This was my second stay at the Solita Soho and it is safe to say there will not be a 3rd visit. In the past i have recommended that hotel to my friends, this won't happen again either!!!

Reviews.Title: “great staff but too noisy”
Reviews.Author: angeladori
Reviews.Content: I am a private travel consultant who mystery shop for a major retailer. I recently had to stay one nignt at the Solita. Its location in Soho was one of the reason i choose this hotel. The room was small but comfortable. furnishing wasa typical hotel, need upgrading. The bed was ok, new mattresses needed. I stay in 423 and this room is located right above the night club that's in this hotel. It was a mistake to put a night club in the hotel, I requested to move to a higher floor but none was available. The noise was unbearable went from 8:00PM to 10:00am the next morning. So if you book this hotel beware. The best part was the staff, especially Emily and Lorelei, who both went out of their way to help me. They turn an unpleasant stay to a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quaint botique hotel, would return.”
Reviews.Author: travelhg
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 2 nights, Friday/Saturday, at the Solita SoHo Hotel and were impressed. Location: The hotel is located only steps from the central spine of SoHo, as well as Chinatown and Little Italy. Though at first glance the street looks a little questionable, we did not observe or have any issues. We parked our car on the street, just a block away, without incident. There are numerous restaurants and clubs in walking distance as well as shops. Hotel: The room was standard size for NY, which all be it means small, but offered everything we needed. The room was spotless and updated in a modern style. Robes were provided, as well as higher end toilteries. We did not find the lobby "ghetto" as noted by some, though it does not offer much besides the reception desk and a small seating area. (but really what else does one need??) We had no issue with noise from the club, though we requested and stayed on a higher floor. We found the staff friendly, though not particularly knowlegable as to offerings for restaurants and nightlife in the area. Though they did offer, without us asking, guides for things to see and do. Touristy magazines were offered in the rooms. A NY Times was supplied on Saturday morning. We would most certainly stay at the Solita SoHo Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Obnoxiously Loud”
Reviews.Author: kauainut
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located for SOHO activities. It is clean. The rooms are nice enough. The room size is small, but fairly ok for New York standards. The water pressure is great. BUT ... The insurmountable problem is the club mentioned by others. We stayed on Friday and Saturday nights on the 3rd floor. It was literally impossible to fall asleep until 2:30 am or later (I think exhaustion did the trick at that point). The music coming from the club (techno stuff) was obnoxiously loud. Every time the bass boomed, you could hear items rattling in the room (I'm not kidding). I still can't get the never ending, techno version of Stars and Stripes Forever out of my mind. With absolute sincerity, I don't understand how a hotel can get away with charging people for these rooms. Maybe the noise is not as bad on higher floors. It was literally unbearable on ours. Which is too bad, because everything else was fine. I just like to be able to sleep. If you make reservations and are stuck on a low floor, you're out of luck.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but very nosiy”
Reviews.Author: saralee-young
Reviews.Content: While the hotel is situated on a nice block in Soho, the night club attached to the hotel would drive you nuts. the music was loud and went on all night long, stopped for an hour then statred up at 5AM on Sunday morning no less. Talking to other guest, they all have the same complain. I will definitely think twice before booking here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very small room, but I liked it overall”
Reviews.Author: Bogus-Blogus
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel. The rooms are small by most cities standards. However, I have stayed in smaller rooms in New York City (and paid a lot more $$). The bathroom was decent size and amenities are good. You can open the room's windows which was great since the weather was nice. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “My New Fave NYC Digs”
Reviews.Author: nashvillemom07
Reviews.Content: Booked a room at the Solita based on Trip Advisor recommendations and wanted an affordable downtown hotel. Went thru Expedia and had no problems at all. Some reviews said hotel was noisy, but we (me, husband and teenage son) were on the 3rd floor facing Grand St. and all slept well. Maybe other travelers were not accustomed to the usual City sounds...I love the constant hum of the city and the nightclub noise was a really faint sound I only noticed a couple of times. The room was typically small (it's NYC!), but nicely appointed. No big amenities, but who in the world eats room service in New York City??? The blocks surrounding the Solita are filled with incredible Peking Duck, dumplings, noodles and roast pork. I am not big on eating Italian in Little Italy (only for newbie tourists!), but there is a neat French restaurant next door and great West Village and LES eateries in short walking distance. If you are an experienced NYC traveler looking for a nice little room to crash in with good linens, flat screen TV, nice service and a convenient downtown location, the Solita can't be beat. We walked past the Sohotel which is much more expensive and it is in a crappy and boring area of the Bowery. We are looking forward to our next trip to the City and will return to the Solita for sure.

Reviews.Title: “OK but disappointed”
Reviews.Author: bermondsey_traveller
Reviews.Content: We took the decision to stay out of midtown for the first time and feel we should have researched a bit better. While the location, like virtually everywhere in Manhattan is great for subway access, the locality verges on being bland with no really great bars or restaurants adjacent. Internet was down and it took days to fix, so the front desk was helpless in answering any queries we had. Many (not all) hotel employees seemed not to be particularly attentive and our room wasn't cleaned until after 2pm. Noise was rather an issue, with the windows not keeping noise out and an adjacent club keeping us up most of the night. Many intercity buses also leave the area at all times of day and night. On the plus side, the room was recently refurbished and pleasant enough with coffee facilities, fresh water bottles each day and bathroom stuff was fine. I guess underwhelmed was the word I would use. Will look for somewhere further west if staying downtown again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, clean, nice people.”
Reviews.Author: linda990
Reviews.Content: Actually it's not much more than a desk and a lot of rooms. But what more do you need when you're in NY? If on holiday, you'll be out of your room most of the time so you need a good and clean bed and bathroom. Everything you need is in the room. A tv, coffee machine, locker etc. It's a small room, yes, but I couldn't be bothered. It really is very important to ask 5th floor or higher because of the nearby club. The people at the desk are so so friendly and willing to help you with everything. The location is the best, feels very good. I will definitely stay here next time I visit NY. C. van der Horst - Amsterdam, The Netherlands

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Emerson06
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Clean, medium size room with two windows looking out to city. Incredible location in Soho, Little Italy, Chinatown area. Great walking area in Soho, Village, etc. Bathroom clean, nice. I have stayed here twice and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: NJFL
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect! The staff was helpful.The rooms are small but VERY clean. after all it's the city. The room we had was a corner room single bed, flat screen TV. The hotel has a hooka lounge at night. The music is very loud, we could hear the music in our room (we stayed on the 4th floor) however it didn't really bother us. Parking is a few blocks away and cost's about $30/$35 for a 24 hour period. When you walk out of the hotel about one block to your right is China Town and Cannel St, and about a block to your left is Little Italy. Overall we enjoyed out stay at this hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in SOHO/Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: cate-h
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is superb. About 2 blocks up from Canal street, a few blocks from Little Italy, and a few blocks from great shopping in Soho. The rooms are really small, but nicely furnished. There is a little noise at night from the nightclub (we were on the 4th floor) but I would think rooms on the higher floors would be quieter. The staff at the front desk was helpful, and the price was definitely good for Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: Nova_7
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a two-night stay at this hotel with my 22 yr-old daughter. We have stayed in the theatre district many times and wanted a different location for a change. This was perfect. Yes, the room was small, but we were only there to shower and sleep, so no problem. The room was immaculate and was nicely appointed. What everyone says is true--a great shower with lots of hot water. We liked the fact that we were only 2 blocks from China Town and Little Italy and very close to Soho shopping. For quick morning coffee and breakfast runs, turn right out of the hotel, go 2 blocks to Ferrara's Italian bakery. Or, go 2 blocks up to Spring St. Balthazaar's french bakery is there. Both were great. We also had a great meal at a little place called Mexican Radio nearby. While this hotel has no ammenities like a gym, restaurant, etc. it's perfect for people like us who were out and about all day and don't go to New York City to hang around the hotel. We will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Noise”
Reviews.Author: pr0claimer
Reviews.Content: Nice comfortable room. Staff friendly enough. But the noise from the nightclub next door was incredible. Might recommend this hotel because of the good location and overall quality but you would want to get one of the top floors if you want to sleep before 4.00am.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Clean, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: stc151
Reviews.Content: This Hotel rooms are small but very clean with great hospitality. Great deal. The young lady at the front desk was very helpful and kind. I brought a group of 25 and they handled the group's needs with propt service. All the people that went on the trip loved their stay. The hotel is very modern equiped with flat screen tv's and sleak interior design. Very accommodating and I would definitly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad and The Ugly”
Reviews.Author: KCMA79
Reviews.Content: The Good: The room was very clean with nice pillows and bed linen. The A/C worked well, not a small thing in summertime NYC. Free internet in room. The Bad: This was probably the smallest room I've ever had in a US property. My room had two beds. One side of each bed was against the wall with less than an 18 in. aisle between them. The room has a tiny wardrobe with a safe being the only storage space. The hotel has NO amenities, no bar, no restaurant, no business center and no parking or decent loading/unloading area. The ice and vending machines are only located in the "lobby" area. The first night the water temp regulator in the shower wasn't working and I almost scalded myself. The A/C was one of the loudest I've encountered, but that did mask the street noise and music from the nightclub others have mentioned. On this visit I was required to have a vehicle. The nearest garage was about 3 blocks away and cost just under $40 dollars to park overnight. Did I mention that this place is small!! There are only 4 rooms per floor!! I could literally stand in the elevator and open the door to my room. The Ugly: I had to cut my stay short due to being called home by my employer. I immediately called the hotel from my work location and told them I would be checking out 2 days early. The desk clerk said OK not a problem. The night before my departure I stopped by the desk to confirm everything with the desk clerk. At first they denied I had met the notification deadline and they would have to charge for an extra night. After I showed her my phone log she then said I told them I was checking out not the next day but the day after that. She said she would check into it and get back to me. She never did. The next morning at checkout the desk clerk was adamant that I said Thurs and not Wed and refused to remove the charge for the extra night. The manager had not arrived for work yet so I couldn't discuss it with them. Since I had a plane to catch I couldn't hang around to wait for the manager to show up. The matter has been turned over to my corporate travel office for resolution. If you are in NYC for pleasure this place might be OK depending on your tastes. If you are there on business avoid it like the plague. The lack of facilities, size and flexibility on the managements part make it a poor choice in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience & reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: July2006traveller
Reviews.Content: I had a very enjoyable stay at this hotel, which is modern, well-maintained, well staffed, and in a great location. I was just a couple of blocks from the Canal Street subway (from which you can get anywhere in a few stops on the express trains), plus three great neighborhoods are within walking distance (Soho, Greenwich Village, Chinatown). Hotel staff are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more - just what we hoped for”
Reviews.Author: PopsterLondon
Reviews.Content: I have just got back from a weekend in New York. I wanted to find somewhere in the heart of downtown and somewhere laid back and pleasant as it was a 30th present for my husband. When I started looking to book I looked at all the fancy boutique hotels around Soho and the East Village, but then came across SoLita in Soho through a web search. I am so glad I booked it. The front of desk staff are really friendly and the room was small, but very clean with a lovely view. The bed linen was lovely, and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom although a little old was clean, and the double headed shower always gave a lovely hot flow. When we stepped outside and got our bearings we discovered we were slap bang between Little Italy and China Town with all its buzz and interest. We were also right by Broadway with all it's shops and only five mins from the centre of cultural Soho. The price was great and you pay for what you get with the SoLita, no frills but very happy friendly service. They booked us a car back to the airport, and we were able to leave our luggage with them, so we could enjoy our last day.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in the hottest part of NYC”
Reviews.Author: Lynne53
Reviews.Content: Looking for a reasonably priced but well located hotel around SOHO, Tripadvisor helped us choose this modest hotel. We were initially concerned by the size of the room (tiny) and were constantly annoyed by the lack of storage space for a couple BUT we had such a good time when we were out of the hotel (which was most of the time) and slept well when we were there that we couldn't see any merit in spending 3 times as much for anything more upscale. The bathroom was fine, beds comfy, housekeeping a high standard. Front desk girls were great - guys not so helpful. Cheap entry to a fantastic gym around the corner was a bonus. One problem - a noisy club abutts the hotel and we could hear "duf duf" on the 5th floor on one night. Fortunately we travel with a white noise maker to drown out such noises. I know the hotel is concerned about this and is trying to tone them down. Best bet - book a room above the 5th floor. In summary, not a "special" hotel but a good, honest and exceptionally well positioned place to call home for a few nights. They would do themselves a favour by increasing storage, even hooks on walls as suggested by a previous reviewer.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: COtennis
Reviews.Content: If you've stayed at hotels in Britain or Europe, you know the rooms at this hotel are NOT small. Compact, yes. Designed well, yes. Besides, you'll only be in your room to sleep or change clothes. Very clean. Friendly and helpful desk clerks. Previous post recommends fifth floor or above; we agree. We stayed on fifth, still could hear the vibrations from the club's music. Would not have wanted to be on third or second. Tremendous location. We walk, and we could get to so many places in a half-hour. Plus, subway stops are nearby. Area is in transition, meaning much construction, but did not affect our stay. Plenty of places to eat on Spring and Broome Streets nearby, also a Dean and DeLuca's six or seven blocks away to buy fruit, snacks, sandwiches, water. We will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you don't get a room over the nightclub!!”
Reviews.Author: echogirl
Reviews.Content: I had heard really great things about this hotel and some were true. The rooms were nice, even though small, the staff was amazing! The only problem, the nightclub!!! the noise level was horrible, even with earplugs! They really need to invest in sound proofing. If ever you stay over for a weekend, make sure to insist on being placed in a room as far away from the club as possible. After 2 sleepless nights I was ready and anxious to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay - Just as nice”
Reviews.Author: breeze1220
Reviews.Content: My friend and I try to get up to Manhattan every year. This year we stayed at the Solita again. The staff there is wonderful, the place was clean and safe, and while it is low on storage space, you can make it work. The one thing I'd love to see them put in is some coat hooks on the wall though :) The beds are comfortable and the room was quite clean. Yes, the room is small, but for the rates and amount of time you actually spend in the room, it's works well. The shower actually has water pressure which is also a nice touch. :) Everyone at the front desk greeted us and there were cars waiting for us when we needed to leave the area. The front desk person was nice enough to arrange that for us when we mentioned we were checking out later that day. The only issue we had was noise from the nightclub downstairs on one of the four nights we were there. The music was turned up loudly, and I think when we go back we will ask for a higher floor (we were on floor 4). The neighborhood is great. You have soho 3 blocks away, chinatown and the subway 2 blocks away, and litte italy 2 blocks away. There's a great diner across the street (reasonable priced, decent food and I have never seen two people work as hard as the ladies in there do). Great for a cheap breakfast or a quick lunch. :) The bar around the corner (Lafayette bar) is a great place (not responsible for the aforementioned noise either). Very nice group of people there. Coming back to the hotel regardless of hour, I never felt unsafe during our stay. I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “A great downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spooney
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from spending a week in New York at the Solita Soho with two friends. We were attracted to the hotel by the good rates and downtown location and were definitely not disappointed. Just a few blocks from the main streets of Chinatown and Little Italy the hotel is in a perfect location to explore the downtown area of Manhattan. Greenwich village, Union Square and the East Village are all walkable if you're a keen walker like me. For places further aflied the Subway is just two blocks away. For breakfast a cafe is located across the street which serves reasonable food and there are lots of other cafes and restaurants in the surrounding area. At night we felt, and indeed were, perfectly safe walking the streets even well past midnight. To the previous reviewer, if you were scared walking around here I dread to think how you would react to a genuinely unsafe neighbourhood. As for our room it was small, as you would expect in NY, but clean and comfortable. Bathroom was compact but we got a small tub and a lovely two-headed shower. The "queen" beds were pretty small but very cosy, and you get a flatscreen TV with plenty of channels. We were up on the 10th floor and had a good view of the old Police Headquarters building and the surrounding streets. The "nightclub" mentioned in other reviews was audible from the lobby but not from our room. Incidentally the entrance to this bar is around the corner on Lafayette Street and is worth a visit - Moroccan themed with live music and a fun, unpretentious crowd of people there. Overall I highly recommend the Solita Soho. It's great location makes for a perfect hotel for those looking to escape the Midtown tourist trap and see more of New York...

Reviews.Title: “Not fitting for business travellers.....”
Reviews.Author: cwill29
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Solita on Jan 18th, I was booked in by my corporate travel dept while I was in the Big Apple attending corporate meetings. I found the hotel to be clean but the format was not to my liking. This has to be the narrowest of any hotel I've ever been in. I stayed on the 7th floor and my room was barely larger than a suburban bedroom, it felt more like a dorm room at college. It was roughly 10x12, clean but very basic, no closet, just a bureau sitting next to a small queen size bed which filled the room. The bathroom was small but clean. My window faced out to the brick wall of a neighboring building and there were construction noises permeating the windows from all around. My neighbors in adjacent rooms felt it necessary to talk in the hallway and party through the night so the doors were no barrier to the commotion that went on in the other 3 rooms on my floor. The hotel straddles Little Italy and Chinatown, but the immediate area is devoid of all life and there's no activity. It was pretty scary at night walking around the surrounding neighborhood. All in all, as a corporate business traveller I would not recommend this hotel to stay in. There are zero facilities and no amenities. I checked out the next morning and found another hotel in nearby Tribeca.

HotelInfo.Name: Solito Soho Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 159 Grand Street, New York City, NY 10013 (Formerly Clarion Collection The Solita Soho Hotel)
